name: Eco Galleria

reviews.text: Nice big place, but non air-conditioned. The shops are air-conditioned though. Pleasant visit with lots for kids to do. Indoor playgrounds, bubble tea, fish & chips, escape room, event square. Def coming back for another short trip.

On first look seems like something g new and refreshing. However, after walking around the first floor, something is amiss, be it the crowd , or variety of stall, just feel like is a ghost mall in the afternoon.  Perhaps during weekend or dinner time it might be more vibrant ðŸ¤”

Itâ€™s a beautiful place to visit, no doubt, but to be honest, it didnâ€™t quite hit the mark for me. That said, itâ€™s still worth checking out, it feels quite different from the usual Malaysian vibe. Hopefully, more shops will open up in the future.

I wouldnâ€™t mind staying in the area, though, especially in one of those Semi-D estates! ðŸ˜†

What a European concept. Superbly good and gives you a fantastic vibe.
Various shops and games too
With several good eateries, shops , barber , cake shop , coffee shopsâ€¦..etc and a good Jaya Grocer. Itâ€™s a good place for family outing in weekend
